text: we are using the chat widget on our 3rd party site and it seems like all form submissions are tracked. the issue is that we have a form where people can invite other users by email, which leads to those emails being associated with the inviter which is not what we want. how can I manage which forms actually get tracked and which don't
I only see a way to globally disable form collection <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms#:~:text=In%20your%20HubSpot%20account%2C%20click,%2Fdisable%20non%2DHubSpot%20forms>.

I am putting our company’s website on to the HubSpot CMS and I was advised that I could use the system domain, (accountNumber).<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>, to develop the site and then once it is done I could simple switch it over to the live domain. Unfortuantely I can’t find any tutorials or help on how to do that, can someone please advise

Thanks in advance

Not sure which channel to post this in, but does anyone know how to implement a script to header and body on knowledge base template? Is it even possible?

We are trying to implement a third party chatbot to the knowledge base. The chatbot works on the rest of the website pages but not on knowledge base..
is this maybe because of the rule that you have set regarding which pages should display the bot in the settings?
I set the script for our knowledge base domain as well, didn’t work
My eyes ignored this warning :see_no_evil:  the banner should have been red haha
ohh
So I guess its not possible :sweat_smile:  ?
yeah, might not be possible
Hey <@U04SQPA9SP4> you can simple connect the Domain to HubSpot, here is a guide: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/connect-a-domain-to-HubSpot>
<@UPJPUM9J4> Thank you for this :smile:
Hi Chris. You need to use the limit query parameter and set it to 100. More info can be found here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>. Let me know if you need more help.

Hey Everyone, would you please help me to upvote this feature request: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Re-enroll-a-contact-in-a-workflow-when-the-email-is-updated/idi-p/786679#M141942> ? Much appreciated :pray:

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Did you ever get an answer this? I’m stuck with the same thing.

We’re trying to send Affiliate links via automation emails but need the tracking function turned off, so when they copy the link it’s the actual link in the text.

Hey y’all. I have a question regarding HubSpot’s 2FA that maybe you have ran into in the past. Right now, our client’s portal requires them to have 2FA turned on for all users. However, we found that if a user sets up 2FA during their account setup and then navigates to Settings > Your Preferences > Security > Remove Primary Method, it basically allows that user to bypass 2FA.

Our concern is that this will be allowed up until some behavior happens (ex. they sign in without 2FA for the 20th and then it requires 2FA to be re-added).
Is that a feature, bug, or a miss? Our preference would be that they do not have to re-add 2FA.
Julian, there is a re-enrollment Beta that allows a re-enrollment on ANY value
does anyone here know the solution to my bug "*Child theme not showing*".

I have some feedback on the new workflow triggers beta

First of all, it's a strong move in the right direction. Most of the elements of this new program are just what's needed to drive progress.

One minor thing - the lack of the ability to enroll based on existing list membership is a weakness of the beta

Similarly the inability to enroll all who currently meet the conditions is frustrating to navigate

Is there anything ongoing to explore these two points?

Hi <@U04BHSVK4L8> We have a beta for event triggers which would allow for this using the "property change event" and you can turn on re-enrollment when the email property changes. If you send me your hub id, I can ungate your portal to the beta

Hi Jordan!

> One minor thing - the lack of the ability to enroll based on existing list membership is a weakness of the beta
Our team is currently working on this! :smile:

> Similarly the inability to enroll all who currently meet the conditions is frustrating to navigate
Could you elaborate more on this? Are you saying those that currently meet the conditions of the existing list membership?

Yes exactly that! I can say that enrolment is based on list membership, but as the contact is already _in_ the list it doesn't seem to trigger as they've not become a member of the list after the workflow was started.

Similarly, if I want it to enroll based on {condition}, the option to enroll contacts currently matching that condition is grayed out and says "unavailable".

This leads to questionable workarounds where I then create an active list based on those conditions and then go to "manually enroll" and mass upload them. This doesn't seem to be how the product is intended to ultimately work.

Another minor point; this beta seems to conflict with the "clean up" feature sometimes in unpredictable ways.

I'm not sure if that's due to the "clean up" feature, the beta, or adverse reaction to the "Seventh Sense" created list cohort app

In some cases this completely trashes a workflow and it just won't "flow" anymore (or work) :joy:

There is no easy "rollback" or "undo" that I can find in workflows, so this typically leads to having to remake very complex workflows from scratch. I have stopped trying to use "clean up", which is a massive shame because it's such a great idea for a feature and I really enjoyed it
I'm happy to have a free inbound ticket too :eyes::eyes:

> but as the contact is already _in_ the list it doesn't seem to trigger as they've not become a member of the list after the workflow was started.
Thank you for the additional feedback! I've shared this with my team as we work on the updates for enroll existing.

(We could potentially have more follow up questions ) :grin:

Regarding the clean up feature, I've shared your feedback directly with the team that is over it! They may reach out with questions also!
Anyone know if it’s possible to make realtime notifications with a HubSpot app?

And also limit users from doing something? Like putting multiple deals in a specific stage? I know I can make a custom code trigger that tests this. But I want to actually disable the ability for users to add more then 1 deal to a certain stage
Like notification inside of the HubSpot App?
Yeah
And display whatever notification you want to display?

This might be what you're looking for: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C0121KGC6RM/p1646839716637449> Built it a long time ago. Asked the team for a notifications api but that wasn't even built so I just built my own
Yeah pretty much anything
Did you see my next message about real-time events?
